roshSummary.whoIsAtRisk:

KNOWN ADULTS:
Such as Ms Victim and any of the victims of the index offence if they are placed close to Mr Offender's cell.

Offener Jr.
roshSummary.natureOfRisk:
[R10.2] IN CUSTODY:

KNOWN ADULTS:
Intimidation, threats of violence, use of weapons or boiling water, physical education and violent assault, long term psychological impact as a result of Mr Offender violent behaviour. This harm may be cause in the course of physical altercation due to seeking revenge or holding grudges...
roshSummary.factorsSituationsLikelyToOffend:
[SUM11] STATIC RISK FACTORS:

Mr Offender gender - At the time of the offence, Mr Offender was 35 years old and considered to be in the higher risk group.

STABLE DYNAMIC RISK FACTORS:
Thinking and behaviour - limited ability to manage mood or emotions poor impulse control. Mr Smith demonstrated cognitive deficit in committing the index offences and this still remains a concern...
roshSummary.factorsAnalysisOfRisk:

A lack of stable accommodation
unemployment
non constructive use of time
breakdown of family support
being unable to access benefits

UNDERLYING FACTORS:
pro criminal attitudes supporting commission of crime...
roshSummary.factorsStrengthsAndProtective:
[SUM10] Engage with Mental Health Services in prison and in the community.
Maintain emotional stability.
Abstain from alcohol.
Abstain from illegal drugs.
Regular testing for alcohol and drug use, in prison and on Licence.
Maintain stable accommodation...
